column4: hey i am installing ubuntu and i am checking cd integrity, it says it will take some time, i have been waiting here for 15 mins now and nothing has happened... is that right?
your cd is fine man you can skip that shit ;)
i'll try installing :)
what hardware are you installing on? notebook or desktop?
as in does the progress bar make it half way and then freeze?
do you have anything else installed on the drive
are you using the live cd for edgy eft?
so just to make sure you have the latest build ubuntu 6.10 edgy eft?
try selecting the first option in boot
you need to start ubuntu install but try using the F option for screen do you see it? i think its F3 or F2 not sure right now
i think it may be your screen resolution that is preventing you from booting into gnome
it was set to 1920 x odd
did you get into F4 and pass the argument in boot?
- got an error  - /bin/sh can't access
set the resolution to 800x600 for now
take IndyGunFreak's advice try the alternate install cd if the setting the screen resolution 800x600 dosnt work. but i think its the VGA settings that are hosing up the system
you could do what the rest of us do and smash your hands into the keyboard, bang your head against the monitor a few times... its worked for me...
dont give up 5 minutes before the miracle happens :)
did you find the alternate cd?
http://ubuntu-releases.cs.umn.edu/edgy/ubuntu-6.10-alternate-i386.iso
not you someone else
sometimes people come in here and demand solutions to common issues when they dont get a reply in 2ms they go berserk.
the reward with linux is when you help others that's how this whole thing started :)
hows it comming along with the install?
